translated: The Jātaka🔽The Collection of Long Discourses
The Chapter on the Short Discourses🔽The Discontented Jātaka
“The discontented, in the guise of the contented,
the unloved, in the guise of the loved,
suffering, in the guise of happiness,
overcome the heedless one.”🔽The Discontented Jātaka is the tenth.
The tenth chapter is called “The Short Discourses.”
The glutton, the toothless, the curious, the mother’s brother,
and the sage, and impermanence, the excellent bowl,
Dhanapāla, the wise one, the one with a thousand,
